page.title: 07CONSERVATION KIRKBY FLEETHAM
page.content:
WE HAVE BEEN THINKING ABOUT THE CONSERVATION OF OUR ENVIRONMENT.WE DO NOT WANT TO SEE ANY MORE POLLUTION.
TO HELP,A LITTLE,WE HAVE BEEN TO KIPLIN HALL TO HELP THE BRITISH TRUST FOR CONSERVATION VOLUNTEERS.THEIR NORTHERN HEADQUARTERS IS THERE.WE HELPED TO CLEAR A POND WHICH HAD BECOME OVERGROWN AND SILTED UP,IT WAS SO BAD NO ANIMALS COULD LIVE IN THE POND. FIRST OF ALL WE SCYTHED AWAY ALL THE GRASSY VEGETATION.THEN WE LOPPED OFF THE SMALL WOODY SHRUBS AND BRANCHES FROM THE PERIMETER OF THE POND.NEXT WE USED A SAW TO SAW OFF THICKER BRANCHES. LAST OF ALL WE WATCHED THE MEN FELL A LARGE TREE.ALL THE LARGE WOOD WAS SAVED BUT WE BURNT ALL THE SMALL TWIGS AND SCRUBBY BITS.
